comments.html: This type of userland networking was the last straw that ultimately drove me away from Linux containers. I tried to love Podman, their general approach and also their ability to run rootless containers are pretty cool. Sadly it leads to these kinds of clutches. It's all detailed nicely in the book Podman in Action by Daniel Walsh. I guess most of the world doesn't have the userland networking problem because they just run containers as root.
comments.name: Jaap de Vos
